alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT GLASSCOCK...SOUTHWESTERN MITCHELL AND SOUTHERN HOWARD COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1115 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sand Springs to 9 miles west of Garden City. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Garden City, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 167 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for western Texas.
